II. THE PLACEMENT OFFICER SHALL ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN WHATEVER FILES ARE
DEEMED NECESSARY FOR THE SUCCESSFUL OPERATION OF THE PLACEMENT SERVICE.
STATEMENT
The purpose of the files listed below is to insure the keeping of
accurate records of all Placement Service activities and to provide quick
and efficient means of reference with regard to the status of any and
all applicants.
At present, the following files are in use by the Placement Service:
A. ACTIVE FILE
This file contains the credentials of all applicants who have
completed their Placement Forms. Prior to the printing of the
Placement Forms all letters of inquiry concerning the Placement
Service were placed in this file. The present file was estab¬
lished when completed Placement Forms began to be received.
Since October 18, 1954 every effort has been made to establish
a definite Active File. A form letter (hereafter referred to
as Form Letter I and found in Appendix B) was sent to the over
two hundred-fifty applicants who had received and not returned
the Placement Forms. This procedure was very helpful in en¬
abling the Placement Officer to determine who did and who did
not wish to make use of the Placement Service. The response
to this letter has been good and has hastened the establishment
of definite Active, Inactive and Dead Files.
B. INACTIVE FILE
This file contains all applicants who have received and not yet
returned the Placement Forms. When the completed forms are
received, the applicants file is transferred to active status.
Prior to the first mailing of the Placement Forms there was no
Inactive File. This file was established for the purpose of
indicating to whom the Placement Forms had been sent.
Since October 18, 1954 this file has been reorganized. The
response to Form Letter I has cleared the file of those who
did not wish to use the Placement Service.
C. DEAD FILE
This file contains the material on those who have not responded
to Form Letter I or who have not chosen to take advantage of
the Placement Service,
Prior to October 18, 1954 there was no dead file.
Since October 18, 1954 this file has grown as the Active and
